alert.note: Alert for Baylor; Knox (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 11:28PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of eastern Knox and southern Baylor Counties through 1215 AM CDT... At 1128 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from near Knox City to 7 miles west of Throckmorton to 4 miles northwest of Fort Griffin. Movement was northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Seymour, Munday, Knox City, Goree, Red Springs, Vera, Gilliland, Rhineland, and Bomarton. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
